roleset.name: attach tightly, physically or metaphorically., constricting physically

example.name: more or less clear
example.text: Yet he is also firmly bound by his hard-line rhetoric and promises he made to anti-abortion activists during his long pursuitof the White House.
example.arg: by his hard-line rhetoric and promises he made to anti-abortion activists during his long pursuitof the White House.

example.name: nasty trace chains
example.text: The fundamental rule of contract law applied to both cases was that courts will not enforce agreements to which the parties did not intend to be bound *[*T] *.

example.name: some kind of understood agreement?
example.text: In the Pennzoil/Texaco litigation, the courts found [Pennzoil and Getty Oil]-3 intended *trace* to be bound *trace*-3; in Arcadian Phosphates they found there was no intention to be bound.

example.name: Args0,1,2
example.text: Their binding the boats to the pier slowed their journey considerably.

example.name: Oh my, how very harlequin
example.text: She was bound by her corset to the frame.

example.name: Metaphorical. This is what happened after the previous example.
example.text: He was bound by a recognizance to not communicate with his ex-girlfriend.
example.arg: to not communicate with his ex-girlfriend.

example.name: Within CXN
example.text: Poor girl said the dress was so binding she had trouble breathing and sitting down.
example.arg: she had trouble breathing and sitting down.

roleset.note: BIND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bind' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, Framenet entry Attaching. (from bind.01-v predicate notes)

BOUND-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, Framenet entry Attaching. Haven't seen this come up as an adj yet, but given the inconsistency in labeling past participles as either adjectives or verbs, here you go... (from bound.01-j)

BINDING-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, no relevant FN entry for this sense of adjective. Loosely based on verb entry, but it seems the adjective only has one arg: the instrument of binding. (from binding.01-j)

roleset.name: be likely

example.name: more than likely
example.text: In our system of advocacy, the trial lawyer is duty bound *trace* to present the best case he possibly can.''
example.arg: *trace* to present the best case he possibly

example.name: raising adjective, there's really only one likely event.
example.text: They 're bound to see sense and start making our streets safer instead of causing the trouble .
example.arg: to see sense and start making our streets safer instead of causing the trouble .

roleset.note: BIND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bind' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, Framenet entry Attaching. (from bind.02-v predicate notes)
BOUND-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from bound.02-j)

roleset.name: attach tightly

example.text: For most people, dishes such as these are forever up with the spirit of New Year.
example.arg: with the spirit of New Year.

roleset.note: BIND_UP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bind_up' based on sentences in ectb. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2, Framenet entry Attaching. Bind_up created by Jena (from bind.04-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: be destined for

example.name: bound-j: Maybe it was her new shaved-head haircut...
example.text: Reports are flying that pop princess Britney Spears is bound for bachelorette-hood once again.

example.name: bound-j: glory bound
example.text: It is rumored *trace* to be bound for a newmodel in the luxury Acura line in the U.S., but Honda officialswouldn't comment.
example.arg: for a newmodel in the luxury Acura line in the U.S.,

roleset.note: BOUND-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from bound.03-j)
BIND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bind' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, Framenet entry Attaching. (from bind.03-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: mode of motion

example.text: [The cost of raising a pig]-3 kept *trace*-3 bounding ahead of the return for selling one.
example.arg: ahead of the return for selling one.

roleset.note: BOUND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bound' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 51.3.2 and 47.8, Framenet entry Self motion. (from bound.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: act as a boundary

example.name: passive
example.text: John's property is bounded by the freeway, a shopping mall, and the city dump.
example.arg: by the freeway, a shopping mall, and the city dump.

roleset.note: BOUND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bound' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 51.3.2 and 47.8, Framenet entry Self motion. (from bound.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: attach tightly

example.name: Args 1,2
example.text: For me, what I did was inextricably bound up with an addiction to substances.

roleset.note: BOUND_UP-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from bound.04-j)

roleset.name: executed with proper legal authority

role.descr: whom contract, law binds, usually "on" phrase

example.name: All args
example.text: The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding on both parties.

example.name: Arg0 only, typical usage
example.text: The next day , the old council make another scene trying to get into their old offices , claiming that the vote was illegal andnot binding , and that they were going to their offices to work asif nothing happened .

roleset.note: BINDING-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from binding.02-j)
